citeinfo.origin: University of Alaska Fairbanks (UAF), University of Alaska Museum
citeinfo.title: Archiving Alaska's Insects - Alaska Sea Grant Radio Show

descript.abstract: Many of us have a teacher to thank for turning us onto interesting hobbies that evolve into lifelong careers. Jim Kruse, the new curator of entomology at the University of Alaska Museum in Fairbanks, is no exception. As Doug Schneider reports in this week's Arctic Science Journeys Radio, one of Jim Kruse's first tasks will be to catalog the insects that live in the far north.
descript.purpose: Jim Kruse owes his interest in butterflies to his first-grade teacher.
